intro: Cyclophorus sticticus, commonly known as the red-stemmed cyclophorus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
